item.title: Best Open-World Games That Don't Hand You Victory
item.description:
Summary

  • Many harsher, unforgiving games force players to adapt and experiment for rewarding gameplay.
  • Games like The Long Dark and Caves of Qud offer challenging experiences with unpredictable outcomes.
  • From STALKER to Elden Ring, exploration in harsh open-world environments adds depth and immersion.

While there's certainly a place for easier, more forgiving open-world games, the lack of challenge and use of instant gratification can sometimes present a watered-down experience. With this can come a lack of experimentation and exploration on the part of the player.

Harsher, more unforgiving experiences, however, tend to force players to adapt and experiment, leading to tough but rewarding gameplay. While these titles certainly aren't for everyone, and some can be inaccessible, they can also be tremendously satisfying to play.

Stalker: Shadow Of Chernobyl

A Hazardous & Unpredictable Landscape

S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl
8.0 /10
Released
March 20, 2007

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language, Use of Alcohol
Powered by

STALKER: Shadow of Chernobyl is a survival FPS set in an interconnected open-world landscape, excelling with its eerie atmosphere and dynamic gameplay. Though a little rough around the edges, an immersive world and variety of emergent systems ensure that Shadows of Chernobyl remains a fun and unpredictable experience.

Exploration is a core part of STALKER 's gameplay, and the various hazards and foes that players must contend with ensure that it's full of surprise and challenge. As a result, simply walking from point A to B is rarely an easygoing experience.

Battle Brothers

A Brutal Sandbox RPG

6 Images
6 Images
Battle Brothers
Indie Games
Tactical
RPG
Strategy
Adventure
Systems
Released
April 27, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
t
Powered by

Battle Brothers excels with its turn-based combat, offering brutal exchanges across a variety of landscapes that require strategic thinking and attention to detail in order to survive. However, even a simple skirmish can result in permanent injury or, worse, the loss of a character.

Combat in Battle Brothers is fair, but there are elements of RNG at play, and even the smallest strategic mistake can cost lives. In addition, there are a variety of survival mechanics that must be managed in order to keep soldiers ready to fight, and attrition can quickly take hold and spiral out of control.

The Long Dark

A Quiet But Hardcore Survival Game

The Long Dark
11
8.1 /10
Released
August 1, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen due to Blood, Language, Violence
Powered by

Though a quiet, contemplative, and often relaxing experience, The Long Dark is a survival game with sharp teeth; it's easy to lose a run of The Long Dark after just a few mistakes, with unfortunate events and slip-ups often leading to deadly spirals.

However, the sheer difficulty of surviving in The Long Dark , at least at first, ensures that it remains a rewarding experience. Additionally, there simply isn't a victory condition in The Long Dark 's survival mode. All runs are, eventually, likely to come to an end.

Fallout: New Vegas

A Harsh & Hostile Wasteland

Fallout: New Vegas
8 /10
22
8.9 /10
Released
October 19, 2010

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Sexual Content, Strong Language, Use of Drugs
Powered by

Fallout: New Vegas is an open-world first-person RPG packed with opportunities for player expression. Emergent gameplay is another of its core strengths, offering dynamic systems that reward adaptive players and creative thinking.

In fact, creative thinking is often required when looking to complete the game's various quests; these quests can often be solved in a variety of ways, and decisions are rarely easy to make. Limited resources and specialized characters ensure that players must approach each obstacle in their own way, and New Vegas rarely, if ever, gives players the keys to the door.

Elden Ring

Challenging Combat In An Open World

6 Images
6 Images
Elden Ring
10 /10
69
9.1 /10
Released
February 25, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Language, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Powered by

While some may not find its open-world as riveting as the interconnected lands of Dark Souls , Elden Ring offers more of the same difficult and expressive combat combined with free-form exploration. And, similarly to Dark Souls , Elden Ring is replete with bosses to overcome.

Luck is rarely, if ever, a factor in Elden Ring , and as is the case with FromSoftware's iconic trilogy, players must often exercise patience to succeed. In many cases, players may need to battle the same foe a dozen times before getting it right, and Elden Ring cares little about how long it takes.

Borderlands

Exploration Of A Tough & Hostile Planet

Borderlands
8.3 /10
Released
October 20, 2009

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
m
Powered by

Of all the Borderlands games, the original title is perhaps the harshest; from the outset, Borderlands challenges players with a great number of enemies that, in most cases, are just a tad more powerful. This doesn't necessarily remain the case for the entire game, and it can be strangely balanced, but the opening segments of the game can be brilliantly harsh.

This extra bite that Borderlands offers works in tandem with its desolate environments and beaten-down ambiance, offering gameplay that synergizes with its setting, music, and writing. As a result, the original Borderlands is still worth checking out, especially for fans of the franchise's later installments.

Kenshi

A Satisfying RPG With A Harsh Exterior

Kenshi
10.0 /10
Released
December 6, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
nr
Powered by

While it is a decidedly slow-burning experience, the harsh and hostile open-world environments of Kenshi offer tremendously rewarding gameplay. Players can expect to spend plenty of time exploring the game's many nooks and crannies, but Kenshi is also packed with hazards and dangers, elevated by emergent gameplay and dynamic enemies/NPCs.

Everything takes time in Kenshi , and so it tends to reward only the most patient and resilient players. However, those that stick out its many challenges are more than likely to find a satisfying and long-lasting experience beneath the harsh exterior.

Caves Of Qud

A Deadly But Diverse Science-Fantasy Landscape

Caves Of Qud
Roguelike
RPG
Systems
Released
July 15, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Powered by

Caves of Qud is an open-world RPG with a roguelike structure, set in a truly exotic and utterly strange land. In the game, players explore a dense science-fantasy world while engaging in turn-based combat, managing resources, and interacting with a wild array of NPCs.

The permanent death mechanic and plethora of ways to perish across its diverse landscape, however, ensures that Caves Of Qud never hands players victory. As a result, getting any character to a higher level is a frequently rewarding experience.

item.title: Great Games That Make Perfect Use Of Simple Gameplay
item.description:
Summary

  • Simple game designs can offer immediate fun and easy learning curves, catering to a wide range of gamers.
  • Immersive horror experiences like Lethal Company excel with streamlined structures despite minimalism.
  • The simplicity of games like DREDGE and Post Void allows for accessible yet engaging gameplay experiences.

While complex systems and game mechanics can be used to great effect, there's something to be said for a more simple design. Complicated games can offer great replay value and diverse gameplay, but this often comes at the cost of a steep learning curve.

Simple games, on the other hand, are often able to offer immediate fun with easy-to-learn gameplay and a fast pace. From the co-operative horror of Lethal Company to the streamlined gameplay of HROT , there's something here for all kinds of gamers.

8 Lethal Company

Simple But Immersive Horror

Lethal Company
8.9 /10
Released
October 23, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
t
Powered by

Lethal Company is a relatively minimalist game, offering an immersive horror experience that excels with its streamlined structure and co-operative play. What elevates Lethal Company 's simple design, however, is both its immersive atmosphere and emergent gameplay.

This emergent gameplay is facilitated by a wide variety of unique monsters, each with their own behavior. This offers dynamic challenges despite the simple gameplay, preventing the game from becoming stale over time.

7 HROT

A Bare-Bones FPS With A Unique Tone

6 Images
6 Images
HROT
Indie
FPS
Systems
Released
May 16, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Powered by

HROT is a simplistic first-person shooter with an old-school style, both in its gameplay and art direction. Taking on a decidedly brown look, HROT 's visuals won't be for everyone, but the game still offers a unique and palpable atmosphere that excels with its minimalism.

Like its visuals, HROT 's FPS action is remarkably stripped back, allowing for clean and accessible gameplay that remains dynamic throughout. Best of all, this simple design allows the game's winning sense of place to stand out all the more.

6 DREDGE

Minimalist But Addictive Gameplay

4 Images
4 Images
Dredge
10
8.2 /10
Released
March 31, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ Due To Animated Blood, Fantasy Violence, Mild Language, Use of Tobacco
Powered by

DREDGE is an open-world fishing game with gameplay as minimalist as its tranquil art-style, offering a relaxing combination of simple mini-games and light exploration. While there are small expansions to the gameplay over time, DREDGE can get repetitive, but it's a flow that many players are sure to enjoy.

The simplistic design is also tremendously intuitive, and this simple gameplay allows DREDGE to be an immediately accessible and consistently relaxing experience. As a result, DREDGE is perfect for gamers looking for a less demanding title, though there are some horror elements at play.

5 ANIMAL WELL

A Quiet & Atmospheric Exploration Game

Animal Well
8.7 /10
Released
May 9, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
E For Everyone Due To Mild Fantasy Violence
Powered by

While it's dense with creative ideas and bursting with imagination, Animal Well is a remarkably streamlined experience that makes perfect use of simple gameplay in order to immerse players in its exotic world. What results is an immersive and mysterious adventure through thick and neon-painted pixel-art environments.

Animal Well is driven by puzzles and exploration, offering a simple structure that remains engaging thanks to its non-linear nature. This streamlined approach is complemented perfectly by simple controls that allow for immediate immersion and accessible fun.

4 Post Void

A Simple But Frantic FPS

Post Void
10.0 /10
Released
August 6, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
t
Powered by

Post Void reveals itself almost immediately, thrusting players into a gauntlet of fast-paced action from minute one. Being a roguelike, this continues indefinitely until players become bored or frustrated, and Post Void works tirelessly to ensure that if it's going to be either, it'll be the latter.

But, similar to games such as Hotline Miami , Post Void is so brutally paced that it's hard to be frustrated for long; it's so easy to snap back into another run through its crucible of tight corridors and crazed enemies, a frenetic ride that works as well individually as it does when repeated.

3 Left 4 Dead 2

A Streamlined Co-Op Experience

Left 4 Dead 2
7 /10
13
8.8 /10
Released
November 17, 2009

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Language
Powered by

Left 4 Dead 2 is a classic co-op horror game that emphasizes teamwork above all else. In this title, players blitz through a variety of campaigns, fighting against hordes of undead. These hordes also contain a variety of special enemies that force players to adapt and work together in order to survive.

However, Left 4 Dead 2 remains remarkably simple thanks to stripped-back FPS action that keeps each level fast-flowing. This allows for a breezy experience that's perfect for co-op, taking little to no time to get started and even less time to ramp up.

2 Thronefall

A Minimalist Combination Of RTS & Tower Defense

Thronefall
Strategy
City Builder
Systems
Released
October 11, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ // Fantasy Violence
Powered by

Thronefall is a simple experience, but it escapes oversimplicity by effortlessly combining elements from multiple genres. Tower/base defense, real-time strategy, and even light action elements are all at play in Thronefall , and they are all elegantly implemented.

The use of simple gameplay in Thronefall is perfect, as it takes a standard structure and twists typically complex mechanics to fit its more accessible approach. As a result, Thronefall manages to be both accessible and engaging.

1 Spelunky 2

A Difficult But Intuitive Experience

Spelunky 2
9 /10
7.0 /10
Released
September 15, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Fantasy Violence, Blood, Mild Suggestive Themes
Powered by

Spelunky 2 is an action roguelike all about delving into dangerous caverns, overcoming enemies and hazards alike, and making it out alive if possible. Doing so is easier said than done, but Spelunky 2 remains accessible via its perfect use of simple gameplay.

The controls are tremendously intuitive, but they also allow for a great deal of player expression via both exploration and combat. Furthermore, the game's structure and systems are simple but interlocking, offering gameplay that's streamlined but dynamic. As a result, Spelunky 2 manages to offer both accessibility and challenge.

item.title: Pokemon World Championships Feature Stunning Homage to Original Games
item.description:
The ongoing Pokmon World Championships features a brilliant homage to the pair of games that started the franchise, sharing a stunning display of an iconic scene. The annual tournament typically serves both as the highest level of tournament for the different branches of the Pokemon franchise and a celebration of the series' rich history. The 2025 World Championships tournament looks to be no different, with the ongoing tournament featuring lots of surprises between the video games and the Pokemon Trading Card Game . However, the event is offering plenty more for fans beyond its tournaments.

The Pokemon Company typically pulls out all the stops to make each year's World Championships a grand occasion for fans. Pokemon GO is running its own event throughout the weekend to coincide with the World Championships, both featuring a special Pikachu and releasing a new code for an in-game shirt. The Pokemon TCG also rolled out a special promo card as part of the event, giving fans the chance to pick up a unique Pikachu card with a World Championships stamp. The main event now features a brilliant homage to Pokemon Red and Blue .

Pokemon is showing off the special display through its official social media accounts, depicting one of the franchise's most memorable scenes. The on-site venue for Pokemon 's World Championships in Anaheim features a special display of a battle arena, with large models of a Nidorino and Gengar squaring off. The scene serves as an homage to the opening animation for Pokemon Red and Blue , showing the two classic creatures from the original 151 battling it out before the games' title screens.

Pokemon Shares Stunning Red and Blue Homage at Worlds

The annual Pokemon event serves as one of the highlights of the year for the beloved monster-catching franchise, with plenty of excitement surrounding it. This year's tournament featured the chance for fans to get a sneak-peek at the next major game release in the series, offering a playable demo for Pokemon Legends: Z-A during the event. Pokemon GO is also giving fans some incentives to join in the competitive fun, with bonus Pokemon encounters and extra Stardust rewards for playing in the GO Battle League during Worlds.

Pokemon 's annual World Championships tournament comes at the cusp of major changes on the way for the franchise. The launch of the previously-mentioned Pokemon Legends: Z-A is less than two months away, with the game's October release whisking fans back to the Kalos region and bringing back Mega Evolutions. The Pokemon TCG will similarly add new Mega Pokemon as an in-game mechanic for the first time since the Pokemon X and Y era of the card game. Pokemon fans should have lots to be excited about from the entire franchise throughout the rest of the year.

Follow
Followed
Pokemon Legends: Z-A
RPG
Adventure
Systems
Released
October 16, 2025
Developer(s)
Game Freak, Creatures Inc.
Publisher(s)
Nintendo, The Pokemon Company

Pokemon

October 16, 2025
Nintendo Switch 2 Release Date

item.title: Best Star Wars Games On PlayStation Plus
item.description:
Star Wars is one of the most popular IPs of all time that needs no introduction. Players love this sci-fi opera and how groundbreaking the original trilogy was, even if the Star Wars IP has been ruined in the eyes of many.

Players with a PS+ subscription can check out some great free Star Wars games on the platform that are fun to play in their own right. From overlooked retro titles to excellent modern games that do justice to the Star Wars IP, there's no shortage of quality games to find on the platform.

Star Wars: Demolition

A Decent Game With Vehicular Combat

6 Images
6 Images
Star Wars: Demolition
7.0 /10
Released
November 14, 2000

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
T
Powered by

Players who want to check out a fun vehicular combat game set in the Star Wars universe will have a decent time with Star Wars: Demolition . The game is best played in short bursts, since there isn't a lot of depth to be found here.

Controlling many iconic Star Wars vehicles and wreaking havoc in these dangerous contests is a blast. The novelty of seeing Boba Fett using a jetpack to fight vehicles is hilarious and more than makes up for this title's faults.

Star Wars Racer Revenge

Players Go Behind The Wheel Of A Podracer

Star Wars Racer Revenge
Racing
Sci-Fi
Systems
Released
February 12, 2002
ESRB
E For Everyone // Mild Violence
Developer(s)
Rainbow Studios

Powered by

High-speed racing games have faded out in the industry, which is why fans will be glad to play titles like Star Wars Racer Revenge . Podracing is an easy excuse for players to engage in a bevy of races that are carried out at lightning-fast speeds.

The gameplay loop isn't too deep, but players looking for a decent podracing game will have a blast with this title. It's simple, intuitive, and doesn't waste the player's time, which is more than what can be said for most modern video game releases.

Star Wars: The Clone Wars

Controlling Iconic Star Wars Vehicles In Combat Is A Blast

Players who loved The Clone Wars arc will have a blast playing this Star Wars game. For the most part, players control all manner of vehicles in the Star Wars universe, but there are some on-foot sections in the game, too.

Here, players control either Anakin Skywalker, Obi-Wan Kenobi, or Mace Windu in high-stakes action sequences. This makes for a simple yet riveting experience that fans of The Clone Wars will have a great time with.

Star Wars: Episode 1 The Phantom Menace

A Decent Action-Packed Adaptation Of Episode 1

While The Phantom Menace 's adaptation is far from a perfect video game, this title is very nostalgic for fans. The gameplay allowed players back in the day to fulfill their wildest dreams of wielding a lightsaber and using Jedi powers.

As long as players don't mind repetitive combat and a lack of enemy variety, they'll have a blast playing The Phantom Menace . Whether players are reliving their nostalgia or trying to understand why people are so fond of this game, their PS+ subscription will help them enjoy this title's charms with ease.

Star Wars: Tales From The Galaxy's Edge

A Great VR Game That Makes The Most Of The Star Wars IP

Star Wars: Tales from the Galaxy's Edge - Enhanced Edition
FPS
Systems
Released
February 22, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen // Blood, Violence
Powered by

VR games can be a tough sell at times, especially for PSVR2 headset owners who feel that this hardware isn't being supported enough by Sony. However, with a PS+ subscription, fans can check out some great virtual reality games to mess around with on the headset.

This includes Star Wars: Tales from the Galaxy's Edge . The base version of this game features a cinematic firefight with some fan service scattered along the way. Meanwhile, the DLC that arrives with the Expanded Edition lets players explore more areas in the Star Wars universe that are great to behold.

Star Wars: Jedi Starfighter

Dogfighting In Iconic Star Wars Starships Feels Great

6 Images
6 Images
Star Wars: Jedi Starfighter
Action
Systems
Released
March 11, 2002

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
T
Powered by

Players who love the dogfighting in the Star Wars games will have a blast with Star Wars: Jedi Starfighter . Once they get the hang of how to fly the spaceship without crashing it, shooting down foes and navigating tricky areas is a blast.

It helps that the game makes an effort to tell a decent story that ties into the series' lore. Using Force weapons in combat and bringing down enemy ships is a blast, making it clear why fans will love Jedi Starfighter if they give it a chance.

LEGO Star Wars 2: The Original Trilogy

Another Excellent LEGO Game Set In The Star Wars Universe

Lego Star Wars II: The Original Trilogy
8.3 /10
Released
September 11, 2006

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
e
Powered by

The LEGO games have done a great job of adapting several popular IPs and recreating these adventures in an interactive format with the signature LEGO flourish. Star Wars is no exception, with this title allowing players to enjoy a fun adaptation of the original trilogy.

Controlling everyone's favorite Star Wars heroes in memorable adventures as they take down Stormtroopers and stand against Darth Vader makes for a great time. The inherent charm of this title ensures that PS+ users who love either Star Wars or LEGO will have a blast with this title.

Star Wars Jedi: Survivor

A Sequel To A Lauded Star Wars Game That Mostly Stuck The Landing

Star Wars Jedi: Survivor
7 /10
22
8.9 /10
Released
April 28, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen due to Mild Language, Violence
Powered by

After the success of Jedi: Fallen Order , it was a no-brainer that a sequel would be released for the same. It's a shame that Jedi: Survivor 's abysmal PC launch prevented it from reaching the heights it deserved, with the majority of the conversation around launch surrounding this horrendous version of the game.

It's a shame, since players will love Cal Kestis' growth as he fights against the tyranny of the Empire. Combat and parkour have been expanded on, with some of the zones in the game being massive and incredible to behold.

item.title: Baldur's Gate 3 Performance Director Praises 'Beautiful' Clair Obscur: Expedition 33
item.description:
Baldur's Gate 3 's performance director recently praised Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 in a social media post. Released on April 24, 2025, Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 is the first project from French studio Sandfall Interactive, and it quickly became one of the most talked-about games of the year.

Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 is a turn-based RPG set in a fantasy world inspired by the European Belle Epoque. Every year, the Paintress wakes up to paint a number on her monolith, indicating the age of people who then mysteriously turn into a pile of flower petals. One day before painting 33, an expedition sets out to find the Paintress, destroy her, and stop the deadly cycle. Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 has become a hit with audiences and critics alike, and this time, another developer has shared their thoughts on the game.

Baldur's Gate 3 Performance Director Says Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 is 'Really Great'

On Larian Studios' official Twitter account, the performance director of Baldur's Gate 3 spoke highly of the game Sandfall's debut title. During a livestream, at the 54-minute and 20-second mark, Lidstone mentions Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 when asked if he is playing any games whose animation or motion capture he liked. The new animation director at Larian noted that he borrowed the game and only played the beginning, but it still made a good impression. Lidstone went further, saying that Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 is a "game that knows what it is and leans into that," which he described as "beautiful." This isn't the first time a Baldur's Gate 3 dev has praised Clair Obscur , with the publishing director also showing support for Sandfall Interactive's RPG.

In addition to the Baldur's Gate 3 development team, other members of the industry have shared their thoughts on the game. John Romero said that "Clair Obscur represents the future of the gaming industry", with the man behind Doom expressing his excitement not only for Sandfall's game, but for other independent titles that can make triple-A studios go. Neil Druckmann, Naughty Dog's head of creative, praised Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 , saying that it was "one of the most creative and exciting stories [he] had played in a long time."

While Clair Obscur 's developers have no plans to expand the team, the game's success should not be limited to the content available at launch. The studio stated that it is considering adding new features to Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 , including more content, accessibility, and localization. However, there is no specific timeline for when these updates will be released.

10 Images
10 Images
